Thanks, I pulled out some code from `IncidentsFrom` in order to prevent the create of an edge list, which isn't strictly needed here.

27a8e61

content.raw: We can add another function that returns a collection of edges. My use case prefers a single edge, or no edge at all.

content.raw: I wonder if returning a collection of Edges would be more generic. If we want to return references we might have to use `std::reference_wrapper`, otherwise we could return a collection of Ids.
content.html: I wonder if returning a collection of Edges would be more generic. If we want to return references we might have to use std::reference_wrapper, otherwise we could return a collection of Ids.

pullrequest.title: Added function to get an edge based on two vertices

content.html:
It might be more efficient to use the adjacency list than the list of edges. This way the search will always contain edges where sourceId is present. E.g.:

for (auto const &edgePair : this->IncidentsFrom(_sourceId))
{
   const auto &edge = edgePair.second.get();
   if (edge.From(_sourceId) == _destId)
     return edge;
}
